data.title: James Franklin (abt.1755-aft.1828)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for James Franklin born abt. 1755 Mecklenburg County, Virginia, British Colonial America died 1828 Sumner, Tennessee including research + descendants + 3 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Son of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 23 Mar 2024 | Created 9 Mar 2012

This page has been accessed 994 times.

Biography

Seeking a Y DNA candidate to participate in the Franklin Y DNA Project representing this Franklin line to determine which group these Franklins belong in within the project. For more information email Lisa.

James Franklin, born in Mecklenburg County, Virginia was married to Mary Jane Lauderdale of Botetourt County shortly before the Revolutionary War.[1] The couple had the following known children:

John Franklin[2]

Isaac Franklin[2]

James Franklin Jr.[2]

William Franklin[2]

Ann Franklin[2]

Betsey Franklin[2]

Jane Franklin[2]

Sally Franklin[2]

Albert C. Franklin[2]

In 1815 James Franklin Sr. sold 132 acres to his son Isaac Franklin, in Sumner County, Tennessee.[3]

James Franklin wrote his will in Sumner County, Tennessee on 18 Dec 1828 and it was presented to the court there for probate at the Feb 1829 term.[2][4]

This profile includes collaborative information about James' slave holdings. Per Census records and Will records the following information has been gleaned.

These enslaved persons were named in the will of James Franklin:

Jacob[2]

Moses[2]

Research Notes

There is major confusion in this family as to the ancestry and descendants of this James Franklin, and which children actually belong to Henry and Margaret Franklin, and a lot of work documenting the family with actual sources, rather than unsourced family tree links needs to be done. Those interested in the family are welcome to use the resource files of the Franklin DNA Project to locate information to help actually source this family group. Please add sources/documentation for any edits/additions and links to parents/children.

Sources

↑ Times-Picayune. 07 Oct 1846. p2. New Orleans, Louisiana.

↑ 2.00 2.01 2.02 2.03 2.04 2.05 2.06 2.07 2.08 2.09 2.10 2.11 Sumner, County, Tennessee Wills, 1823-1842. Vol. 02. p91-92. FamilySearch Image: S7WF-SNLY-L9 (accessed 5 July 2022)
